DisplayedItem.name: DI_45837
DisplayedItem.title: # Only inguinal and femoral nodes are considered regional lymph nodes. Any other involved nodes are categorized as metastases (pM1) and should be described in a comment in the distant metastasis section. Presence of isolated tumor cells no greater than 0.2 mm, or single cells or cell clusters no more than 200 cells in regional lymph node(s) is considered N0(i+).

ListItem.name: LI_48001
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_43834
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor cells

ListItem.name: LI_47515
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_42259
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_42259_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_936988
DisplayedItem.title: Regional lymph nodes include inguinal and femoral nodes. Involvement of internal iliac / hypogastric, external iliac, and common iliac lymph nodes is considered distant metastases. The site, size, and laterality of lymph node metastases should be recorded.

ListItem.name: LI_936989
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937001
DisplayedItem.title: # Histologic examination of an inguinofemoral lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information).

ListItem.name: LI_936990
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)#

Property.name: p_rptTxt_936990_1
Property.val: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

Question.name: Q_937011
Question.title: FIGO Stage (2021 FIGO staging for carcinoma of the vulva)

ListItem.name: LI_937012
ListItem.title: I: Tumor confined to the vulva

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937023
DisplayedItem.title: # Depth of invasion is measured from the basement membrane of the deepest, adjacent (or nearest) dysplastic, tumor-free rete ridge to the deepest point of invasion.

ListItem.name: LI_937013
ListItem.title: IA: Tumor size less than or equal to 2 cm and stromal invasion less than or equal to 1 mm#

ListItem.name: LI_937014
ListItem.title: IB: Tumor size greater than 2 cm or stromal invasion greater than 1 mm#

ListItem.name: LI_937015
ListItem.title: II: Tumor of any size with extension to lower one-third of the urethra, lower one-third of the vagina, or lower one-third of the anus with negative nodes

ListItem.name: LI_937016
ListItem.title: III: Tumor of any size with extension to upper part of adjacent perineal structures, or with any number of non-fixed, non-ulcerated lymph node(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937024
DisplayedItem.title: ## Regional lymph nodes include inguinal and femoral nodes.

ListItem.name: LI_937017
ListItem.title: IIIA: Tumor of any size with disease extension to upper two-thirds of the urethra, upper two-thirds of the vagina, bladder mucosa, rectal mucosa, or regional lymph node metastases less than or equal to 5 mm##

ListItem.name: LI_937018
ListItem.title: IIIB: Regional lymph node metastases greater than 5 mm##

ListItem.name: LI_937019
ListItem.title: IIIC: Regional lymph node metastases with extracapsular spread##

ListItem.name: LI_937020
ListItem.title: IV: Tumor of any size fixed to bone, or fixed, ulcerated lymph node metastases, or distant metastases

ListItem.name: LI_937021
ListItem.title: IVA: Disease fixed to pelvic bone, or fixed or ulcerated regional lymph node metastases##
